stu_tags: PARTICIPATION MATTERS  GET READY TO READ
comments: I would give a difficulty rating of 3.5 - an A is very attainable, but stay on track with the readings or recitation/clicker quizzes will screw you. The guy is hopelessly biased, but he does allow questions/debates during lecture. If you\'re willing to put in more than work than usual for a 100 level, this is a good class to take for the core.

comments: Pin 5 stars on this mans chest. The way he speaks of military topics that have nothing to do with extinction would lead one to believe he was a military general. The policial nonsense this dude applies to extinction is appalling. His lectures are long and boring and pointless and his treatment towards students that approach him is plain rude.

school_name: Rutgers - State University of New Jersey

stu_tags: EXTRA CREDIT  AMAZING LECTURES  GET READY TO READ
comments: His class is not as hard as people make it out to be and is very interesting. As long as you do the extra credit and you do the readings you\'ll get an A. Like I am currently at a 103%. He is very passionate about the topic and his lectures are great. He is really funny and is not out to get you like everyone is saying. Take the class!

school_name: Rutgers - State University of New Jersey

stu_tags: EXTRA CREDIT  GET READY TO READ  LOTS OF HOMEWORK
comments: Easily the most boring class I have taken. The Prof goes off topic too much, and even though he is nice by heart the class is way too much. So much reading along with a five page paper on finals week. You have to come to lecture because of mandatory clicker quizzes, and the material is insanely boring. Do NOT take extinction.

stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES
comments: Worst class I have ever taken. Professor Scott never stays on topic in lecture which makes it impossible to follow along, concentrate, or even learn anything. There are so many readings (some of them 30 pages long) and they\'re assigned for every class. The tests are extremely difficult and he refuses to offer any aid for the exams. Too much stress!

school_name: Rutgers - State University of New Jersey

stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  GET READY TO READ
comments: If you\'re looking to take Extinction to get an easy A, don\'t. There are a lot of readings and 4 essays that require research + those readings. The midterm/final are very readings-heavy. The lectures are boring. You have to go to lecture because he takes attendance with iclicker q\'s. Participate in recitation because it counts toward your grade.

comments: Professor Scott, might be the worst professor to teach at Rutgers. He tends to get very sidetracked and gives you about 15 seconds to copy down what is on the slide. He is very boring and the lectures are very hard to sit through. There are clicker "quizzes" every class so if you dont go to class you are screwed. Would NOT recommend to anyone.

stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  EXTRA CREDIT  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: There are a lot of readings, but it\'s manageable if you stay on track and I thought all of the readings were helpful to understanding the lecture topics. Lecture\'s were not amazing, but I didn\'t fall asleep. He\'s very passionate about the subject, and I think in order to enjoy the class you should have a prior interest in biological anthropology.

comments: Rob Scott isn\'t too good. His class is based on clicker questions which are really weird, one of them mentioned Shakira and hips don\'t lie (?), one midterm and the final both of which are pretty hard, midterm avg was a 65, and recitation quizzes. The quizzes are fairly easy as long as you go to & pay attention there, but the class is not an easy A.

stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  GET READY TO READ  LECTURE HEAVY
comments: He asks broad questions and has a specific answer in his head and expects everyone to know what he\'s thinking (even when it is proven to him there are other correct answers). People don\'t want to raise their hand because if you\'re wrong he\'s rude about it or ignores you. I don\'t recommend this class, the test questions are hard and worded weird

comments: If you\'re looking for an easy A class, don\'t choose this class. He assigns a boat load of readings every night. His lectures or long and boring; I found myself very lost by the middle of lecture. He does in class quizzes using the clicker and doesn\'t post his PowerPoint slides on Sakai. I would not recommend this class.

comments: He gives hundreds of readings by the end of the semester, some up to 25 pages in length, with all of them ending up on the exam. Lectures are extremely long and painful, gets lost in his own excitement over the subject instead of actually worrying about teaching the students. Gets angry if you don\'t speak up

comments: Prof. Scott gets a bad reputation because he goes off on tangents during class, which is true, but in general I enjoyed the class. The topics are interesting and Scott is very enthusiastic about everything he is teaching. He posts the slides online so it is clear what information is important. Show up to class and take notes and you should get an A

comments: STAYY AWAYY!! I took this class for an easy A and it proved to be a pain. Take another class for requirements because this class is for those who are really into this field. Having other hard classes and this class was very hard because I had to leave Extinction as the last class I had to worry about. My TA graded papers way too hard.

comments: Prof Scott is very funny, and is genuinely interested in what he teaches. Interesting, fulfills lot of core. He\'s good at making things interesting, and he\'s really funny. Good extra credit options. There is a ton of reading, though, and it is tested on the final/midterm. Also daily attendance clicker quizzes on subject from class or reading.

comments: Prof. Scott does not stay on topic, and does not explain the material the way it should be. Lectures were painfully boring and when it came time for the final, the notes wouldn\'t even matter. There were a substantial amount of questions that had nothing to do with lectures. Also 30% of midterm and final were on the online readings. Don\'t take him!

comments: This class was painfully boring. I ended up getting an A in the class even after skipping multiple lectures because I couldnt stand to sit through lecture. Definitely go to all recitations but the lectures are fairly common sense material. Lots of readings, skim them before exams

stu_tags: EXTRA CREDIT  LOTS OF HOMEWORK  GET READY TO READ
comments: Dr. Scott is a nice guy and really has an interest for Anthropology. Extinction is a class I took for credit and to help fulfill my core requirement. I was quite surprised to find out the class is quite difficult. There is a ton of readings you need to do for clicker quizzes and exams. The slides are unorganized and messy.

school_name: Rutgers - State University of New Jersey
tag_professor: Get ready to read (36)  Tough Grader (18)  EXTRA CREDIT (16)  LECTURE HEAVY (16)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (12)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  TOUGH GRADER  LOTS OF HOMEWORK
comments: For an introductory level class, Prof. Scott expects you to have to be a expert in science and a expert in evolutionary anthropology which is his department. He gave out very intense and hard readings, and he will make you think that you should only focus on his class. He is trying to get student to major in anthropology.
